intro: Anisopappus angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to survive in dry conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the milkweed family.
